page.title: 06FARMING
page.content: Most of the farmland in our area is owned by the{Munro Ferguson}family of{ {Raith Estate.}The whole Estate consists of 500 acres of woodland and 2000 acres of arable land, although it is not all in our area. { Raith House}was built in 1695 and was bought by the Fergusons in 1725 .The woods were planted in 1785 and the lake was built about the same time. Six workers are employed on the Estate to look after the{beef cattle which are reared and fattened there and to farm the crops which include {wheat, barley, oilseed rape, peas, {potatoes }and{Brussels sprouts. As{pheasants}are reared in the woodland two gamekeepers are employed to look after these. The Laird also employs a factor, an estate joiner and a housekeeper.
